item.description: a good explanation of Frontier as well.Link

item.title: Dan Gillmor Draws a Line in the Sand
item.description:
"Here's my message to the record industry and its allies:

I'm not a thief. I'm a customer. When you treat me like a thief, I won't be your customer.

Enough is enough."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Looping in XSLT
item.description:
good examples of looping in xslt.

a follow-up msg shows examples of looping in xslt 2.0Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Legos and the Semantic Web (via XMLHack)
item.description: Good overview explanation of the concepts behind the semantic web.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Associative Databases on Wiremine
item.description: "The associative model doesn't use tables. It stores all the "things" (name, fax number, birthday, etc.) completely separate from the "relationships" (known as "associations", which is where the name comes from) between those things. For example: Person has a name, Person has a birthday, Person has a photography, and so on. If you want to add a new piece of information to an existing thing, you create the thing and then associate it with the old one without modifying the structure of the database."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Question: What did the instructor at the school for Kamikaze pilots say to his students?
item.description:
Answer:

"Watch closely. I'm only going to do this once."

(Author unknown)Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Money Origami (via Boing Boing)
item.description: "Folding paper money (or "money origami") is my one true creative output. My best original designs include spiders, eyeglasses, sailboats, and framed portraits. I got started in high school when I learned how to make a ring out of a dollar bill. I generally make these items to leave as tips."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Building Taxonomies (MS Press, via IA)
item.description: "Building taxonomies. Chapter 6 of Susan Conway's and Char Sligar's book Unlocking Knowledge Assets is available on Microsoft Press' site. The chapter entitled "Building Taxonomies" defines what taxonomies are, how they play a role in content management and how to build and maintain them."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Old Persian proverb
item.description: Trust in God, but tie your camel.Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Nicholas Lehuen on Schema Validation (xml-dev)
item.description:
"I still don't understand why validation is not performed in a SAX filter rather than in parsers. Parsers like Xerces have dramatically grown in size and have performance problem due to the fact that validation is built in the parser.

To me, parsing and validating are two different activities. They may have

been integrated for performance reasons of the parsing+validation pipeline,

but I'd still like to have a clean, high performance parsing pipeline in

which I could plugin any kind of validators (eg. Sun MSV).

Take the bug that causes Xerces 2 to dereference and parse schemas even if

validation is disabled for example. I hope it has been fixed since, but if Xerces 2 was not mixing a lot of APIs and technologies (parsing, validating, building a DTD specific DOMs, etc.) in a monolithic way, the bug would have never appeared in the first place."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Word HTML Cleaner for PHP
item.description: "This utility strips proprietary Microsoft tags and artefacts from Word HTML documents, leaving basic formatting and typographic entities intact. Curled quotes and em and en dashes should come through fine, as long as they existed in the original Word document: run Autoformat to be sure."Link
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala

item.title: Andrew Layman on Serialization of Null Values (SOAPBuilders)
item.description: "If you open up a cupboard and don't find a bicycle, are the cupboard's contents different than if you opened it and didn't find an elephant?" - Andrew Layman, during a discussion of techniques for serializing null values in XMLLink
item.dc:creator: Dietrich Ayala
